data.title: A new line appears after executing commands with parameters using the dash/minus symbol "-" with zsh
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1  9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e 
- OS Version: Fedora 21 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open to the integrated terminal, using zsh.
2. Execute the following command.
> ls -al
3. Repeat until the lines with the same command are formatted as follows:
> ls -
al
4. Try to execute the same command or another one with a "-" used, like for example to add configuration parameters like:
> babel --
version
5. The attribute is misplaced in another line and this happens from the executed commands onwards.
6. The command runs fine but is quite annoying have the lines stacked like that.
![new line](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/356675/19844344/25fe89e6-9f02-11e6-9400-07f8a5120db5.png)

data.title: Debugging - UI/protocol support for "blackbox script"/"Just my code"
data.body:
Chrome devtools calls this "Blackboxed scripts" and VS/F12 use "Library code" and "Just my code".

This feature has been requested several times - examples, 
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3215
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-chrome-debug-core/issues/7
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-node-debug/issues/16.

It could be implemented entirely in the debug adapter, with a new option in the launch config, and I hope to do that to try it out. But when I've used it, I've found it most useful when I can mark a script as "library code" on the fly. For this, we would need a context menu option on the callstack which can mark/unmark a particular script as library code, debug protocol support, and a toggle button to globally enable/disable the feature. (For the last item, we could use the 'exceptionBreakpointFilters' - is there anything wrong with reusing that for something besides exception breakpoints?) We also need to persist these.

This is implemented by the chrome debugging protocol. For reference it looks like this - https://chromedevtools.github.io/debugger-protocol-viewer/v8/Debugger/#method-setBlackboxPatterns - but we really just need a message that includes a DebugProtocol.Source and the library code state. I think this is of general interest since VS implements it for Javascript, C++, C# and other languages.

Thoughts/comments?

data.title: Command palette should rank results with closer search terms higher
data.body:
_From @prashantv on October 18, 2016 19:56_

See image:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/140159/19494026/13f00a92-9532-11e6-8a1d-124d94b814b6.png)

I think a user is much more likely to want to run unit tests when they search for "Go Test" than "Generate unit tests". Is there any way to improve the search matching, or rename the option so running unit tests is preferred over generating unit tests?

_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/vscode-go#543_

data.title: Can we still display the Debug output window on the side
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6
- OS Version: OS X

In the older versions (don't remember the version, but fairly old) of VS Code, the debug output panel would be displayed on the right hand side (right hand side of the editor).
Today this output panel is displayed at the bottom along with the other output panels (like tasks, terminals etc).

Is it still possible to display the `Debug` output window on the right hand (see below).

![Image](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DonJayamanne/pythonVSCode/master/images/standardDebugging.gif)

data.title: Command unFoldRecursively should be unfoldRecursively (lowercase f) for consistency
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6.1

Other "unfold" commands use lowercase 'f':
- editor.unfold
- editor.unfoldAll

editor.unFoldRecursively should be editor.unfoldRecursively for consistency.

data.title: Array preview shows item count as first item and drops last item
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.7.0 insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

var array1 = [ 1, 2, 3 ];
shows up on hover, Watch, and REPL as
Array[3] [3, 1, 2]

![arrayoutoforder](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12818376/19840398/1ed5114e-9eb2-11e6-8f25-c736eb472076.png)

This appears just to be out of order but if you change to strings you can see what's happening.

var array1 = [ "hello", "world" ];
results in
Array[2] [ 2, "hello" ]

The array count is shown as the first item and the last item is dropped.

![arraycountfirst](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12818376/19840485/2dcae852-9eb4-11e6-82eb-5830e61c576b.png)

data.title: If you modify the "editor.lineHeight" setting, multiline tooltips will overlap
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1,6,1 - OS Version: win10x64 Steps to Reproduce: 1. install the [vscode-eslint](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=dbaeumer.vscode-eslint) extension. 2. Open a new file, set as language Javascript, and type this: var a = [1, 2] 3. Here is how the tooltip lines are displayed (after clicking the balloon icon) while the `editor.lineHeight` setting has its default value (0) : ![2016-10-30_233100](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/723651/19840180/781e55ac-9ef9-11e6-9d8d-e61a534842d3.jpg) 4. Now, in File|Preferences|User Settings add this entry `editor.lineHeight": 15` ( \* ) Here is how the tooltip lines are displayed: ![2016-10-30_233128](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/723651/19840194/b13a4d14-9ef9-11e6-9961-55ebc495f334.jpg) i.e. they now overlap.
( \* ) I use that setting combined with`"editor.fontSize": 13` but this doesn't affect the issue.

data.title: Unable to Remove Binding for Workbench ZoomIn and ZoomOut
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.12.1

Per [these](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/customization/keybindings#_removing-a-specific-key-binding-rule) instructions, I attempted to remove the zoom in and zoom out behavior of the workbench in order to let the OS use the binding.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Unbind the keys:

```
  { "key": "cmd+=",                 "command": "-workbench.action.zoomIn" },
  { "key": "cmd+-",                 "command": "-workbench.action.zoomOut" }
```
1. Then use `cmd+=` and `cmd+-` and the workbench still zooms in and out.

data.title: Add option to prevent same file opening twice
data.body:
Sometimes I've forgotten that I have opened the same file twice in two or more panes in vscode. This has led me to edit the wrong file opened which in turn creates confusion as to why my code isn't working as intended.

I'm wondering, could an option be added to prevent the same file being opened more than once. If it is opened in a new pane, let the other opened version close (do you want to save edits etc.).

data.title: add setting to open folders in a new window, fixes #371
data.body: I used the same logic used for the window.openFilesInNewWindow setting

data.title: Lag when scrolling with Trackpad on Dell XPS 13
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

On my Dell XPS 13, scrolling in Visual Studio Code using two fingers in any view (Editor, File Tree, Terminal, Extensions) has a lag to it. Especially when starting the drag, most of the time it won't start moving for half a second and then jump a large distance into the scroll direction.

Scrolling on the Touch display works without problems.  Also, of course scrolling with two fingers on the Trackpad in _any_ other application works without problem. (Also tried it in Atom)

data.title: Debug widget doesn't show up until successful attach
data.body:
I don't know if this is covered somewhere else -

Start an attach config with the wrong port
Nothing shows up for 10 seconds until the attach times out, and the infobar error appears.

Previously in 1.6, the widget showed up immediately, so you had immediate UI feedback that something was happening, and could cancel it without waiting.

data.title: Add an option to confirm before quitting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6
- OS Version: OSX Sierra

Many times on a Mac it is necessary to use `cmd+`` to navigate between projects. This can lead to a mishit on `cmd+q` very easily. It would be great to have a confirm quit feature. Something like this sublimetext extension https://github.com/xavi-/sublime-maybs-quit

Thanks!

data.title: Hitting backspace doesn't move cursor to previous indent column.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T15:43:46.054Z) - OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-45-generic - Extensions: DavidAnson.vscode-markdownlint-0.5.0, EditorConfig.EditorConfig-0.3.4, ajhyndman.jslint-1.2.1, dbaeumer.jshint-0.10.15, dbaeumer.vscode-eslint-1.0.8, eg2.tslint-0.5.39, jakethashi.vscode-angular2-emmet-1.0.9, ms-vscode.cpptools-0.9.2, msjsdiag.debugger-for-chrome-2.1.1, vscodevim.vim-0.4.0 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Type a line, hit return 2. press Tab 3. press backspace Cursor moves back single space, doesn't move back to previous indent column. This also happens with exiting code, html tags and inside backticks. You can use the following code see this. ``` js @Component({ selector: 'lifecycle', template: `

{{title}}

Count: {{count}}
`, styles: [] }) ```

data.title: Notify the user that backups exist but have not been restored if the folder to be restored no longer exists
data.body:
Moving this over from #14063

After https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/62ec04bb71d6185653aed6592e7c3245060e1ab4 the backups are not restored if the workspace directory doesn't exist anymore. The workspace is no longer tracked but the backups are kept around in the backup directory should they be needed later.

data.title: Code formatting doesn't work on long lines with commas.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T15:43:46.054Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-45-generic
- Extensions: DavidAnson.vscode-markdownlint-0.5.0, EditorConfig.EditorConfig-0.3.4, ajhyndman.jslint-1.2.1, dbaeumer.jshint-0.10.15, dbaeumer.vscode-eslint-1.0.8, eg2.tslint-0.5.39, jakethashi.vscode-angular2-emmet-1.0.9, ms-vscode.cpptools-0.9.2, msjsdiag.debugger-for-chrome-2.1.1, vscodevim.vim-0.4.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Type following line in code

``` js
import { Component, OnInit, OnChanges, DoCheck, AfterContentInit, AfterContentChecked, AfterViewInit, AfterViewChecked } from '@angular/core';
```
1. Format code, nothing happen. I expect "column formating" after the commas like this:

``` js
import { Component, 
         OnInit,
         OnChanges, 
         DoCheck, 
         AfterContentInit, 
         AfterContentChecked,
         AfterViewInit, 
         AfterViewChecked } from '@angular/core';
```

data.title: Better java, gradle support
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6.1
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra

We would like a more out of the box java support without relying on maven or eclipse.

1) open a java project (gradle if possible)  and be able to execute gradle tasks out of the box
2) be able to compile and run java apps
3) be able to local and most important remote debug java applications
4) keep on improving git support!

plugins existing now are not giving a good experience working with them in such a way.
This features would make vscode the one ide to rull them all, thanks for the excellent work!
